etymologies: mid 16th century: from Middle Dutch siseken, a diminutive related to German Zeisig, of Slavic origin

definitions: a small songbird related to the goldfinch.

notes.text: Genus Carduelis (and Serinus), family Fringillidae: several species, including the pine siskin (C. pinus) of North America, with dark-streaked plumage, notched tail, and touches of yellow on wings and tail

shortDefinitions: small songbird with yellow and black plumage
